profileAlternative.name: Kesha Williams
profileAlternative.headline: Software Engineer & AWS Technical Instructor @ A Cloud Guru, AWS ML Hero, Alexa Champion, AWS Certified, Speaker, Author
profileAlternative.summary:
Kesha Williams is an award-winning software engineer, machine learning practitioner, and technical instructor at A Cloud Guru with 24 years’ experience. She's trained and mentored thousands of software engineers in the US, Europe, and Asia while teaching at the university level. She routinely leads innovation teams in proving out emerging technologies and shares her learnings at conferences across the globe. She's spoken about machine learning on the TED stage as a winner of TED’s Spotlight Presentation Academy. Additionally, her pioneering work in the field of artificial intelligence earned her the distinction of both Alexa Champion and AWS Machine Learning Hero from Amazon. In her spare time, she leads the Georgia chapter of Technovation and mentors women in tech.

-To learn more about me, visit my website at http://www.kesha.tech.
-Do you want me to speak at your event, set up a meeting using my calendar https://calendly.com/keshawillz

positions.title:
Title
Freelance Technical Instructor
positions.description: I am the instructor/author for A Cloud Guru's Soda-theft Detection Device maker lab. In this lab, I unbox the AWS DeepLens device and use deep learning models and computer vision to prevent soda theft.

positions.title: Freelance Instructor
positions.description: I am an instructor in the following nanodegree programs: Cloud Developer, Cloud DevOps, and Java Developer.

positions.title: Freelance Author
positions.description: I am the author of "Spring Boot Fundamentals”, Spring Data Mongo: Getting Started", "Building Microservices REST APIs Using Spring Data REST", and "Data Transactions with Spring".

positions.title: Freelance Author
positions.description: I am the author of "Debiasing AI using Amazon SageMaker", "Java Persistence API (JPA): The Basics", "Java Persistence API (JPA): Inheritance and Querying", "Java EE: Web Services", and "Programming Foundations: APIs and Web Services".

positions.title: Freelance Author
positions.description: I am the author of "AWS Machine Learning in Motion".

positions.title: Freelance Author
positions.description: I am the author of the course, "Using Amazon Alexa to Perform Voice Activated CI/CD Builds and Deployments".

positions.title: Freelance Author
positions.description: I am the co-author of "Beginning Machine Learning with AWS"

positions.title: Java Editor
positions.description: I am an editor for the Java section of InfoQ. I contribute news on all aspects of Java, the JVM and related ecosystem.

positions.title: Adjunct Instructor (Java)
positions.companyName: University of California, Irvine Division of Continuing Education
positions.description: Developed online courses in the topics of Java programming, object-oriented analysis & design, and design patterns. I taught and mentored students of various ages from around the world.

educations.title: Spelman College
educations.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Mathematics
